IntarestingFact: India is the world’s largest democracy.
Japan has more pets than children.
Canada has the longest coastline in the world.
Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, the largest in the world.
Australia is the only continent covered by a single country.
Ancient Egyptians invented one of the earliest writing systems—hieroglyphics.
France is the most visited country in the world.
Iceland has no standing army.
South Korea has the fastest average internet speed in the world.
Norway introduced salmon sushi to Japan in the 1980s.
Mexico introduced chocolate to the world.
New Zealand was the first country to grant women the right to vote.
Germany is home to the world's largest beer festival, Oktoberfest.
The U.S. has no official language at the federal level.
Russia spans 11 time zones, more than any other country.
The UK is made up of four countries: England, Scotland, Wales, and Northern Ireland.
Rome has a sovereign country within it—the Vatican City.
Spain has the second-highest number of UNESCO World Heritage Sites.
China is the world's most populous country.
Switzerland has four national languages.
Thailand is the only Southeast Asian country never to have been colonized.
Argentina was the first country to use fingerprints in criminal investigations.
South Africa has three capital cities, each serving a different purpose.
Istanbul is the only city in the world located on two continents.
